messageBody:
christiano_80218@... wrote:

>Hi all,
>
>just need a clarfication what kind of setup code should be put in a
>TestSetup.
>
in fact you can use the setUp() method to group all folks needed by
unitary tests.
If example given your test methods require some object state, just put
the init code here.

.....
private MyObject obj;
protected void setUp(){
obj = new MyObject();
obj.setState(aParticularState);
}
...

>
>If I manipulate the state of a test class ( e.g. via static methods )
>in the TestSetup, I loose the possibility to run single tests from
>the swing ui.
>
yes you're right, moreover don't use static methods inside EJB (cf EJB
specs from Sun)

>
>On the other hand, this way would be very convenient, if your setup
>code must be done only once.
>
but that's the aim of the setUp method (cf Junit doc)



Cheers
Jerome
